definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

sentences.english: He directed his troops toward the Nile Delta.
sentences.chinese: 他挥师直捣尼罗河三角洲一带。

sentences.english: Caesar marched north into the forests that border the Danube River.
sentences.chinese: 恺撒挥师北上，深入到多瑙河沿岸的森林地带。

sentences.english: The general advanced his troops to the new position.
sentences.chinese: 将军挥师前进到新阵地。

sentences.english: We depart for the north with the tide.
After the term of the armistice expired in 1590, Russian troops moved in to take them back.
sentences.chinese: 在1590年停战期满后，露西亚军队挥师收复失地。

definition: to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
the Northern Expedition, the Nationalists' campaign of 1926-1928 under Chiang Kai-shek, against the rule of local warlords
